description: From Middle English lethi, from Old English liþiġ (“free, unrestrained, flexible”), from Proto-Germanic *liþugaz; equivalent to lith (“limb, joint”) +‎ -y. Cognate with Dutch ledig, German ledig, Swedish ledig, Icelandic liðugur.

adjectives.description: lithy (comparative more lithy, superlative most lithy)
